What is a wavetable synthesis?
Well it's a form of synthesis very similar to subtractive but the main difference, you're not only limited to the basic set of waveforms like a sine wave, square wave, triangle wave and softed wave.
You can create basically any shape of the waveform you want, you can use samples to create a waveform.
And the other very important difference is that instead of having only one, you can have multiple waveforms and they stack on one another and then you can morph between them.
